alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 3:00PM EDT until April 05 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR EASTERN SHELBY COUNTY... At 300 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sidney, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Sidney, Anna, Jackson Center, Hardin, Port Jefferson, Maplewood, Montra, Newbern, Swanders and Pemberton. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 90 and 101. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for west central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
